comments.text: Waited 3 hours for a ride across the channel.
Took 5 mins to get a truck across the channel :)
And go TALK with the drivers, some politely said that they wont give me a lift, some gave some tips. Very few stops just for the sign, although it helps a little, shows that you are more trustable.

Do not try going up north around London from east side. I was going Sunderland from here, and after two hours I deicded to head back to Dover, then in 1 hour truck took me. Everyone seems to be going South.
In 1 hour got 2 ride offers, one just to Folkestone, the other to Paris, which we accepted.
I have multiple times had good times hitching towards Uig from here.
July 2019: We were on our way to Uig and we got a ride almost straight away, we must've waited for 10min tops.
Is actually Portree
Hitch right after the co-op supermarket.
The place is good for going direction South! It took me just 5 minutes to find a car, but walking to there is a little bit hard if your backpack is heavy
3 girls direction to EDN, without a sign. we had to walk a bit into the main road (the cars are going fast but they have some space to stop) We found a ride for the half distance.
Hitching long distance is better with a sign because a lot of people going to about 1/2 hour outside inverness
No problems with inside-lane traffic turning off as you may find at earlier laybys on the A9 heading south. Never waited longer than half an hour here - even though it's quite a slog up the hill!
normally locals will give you a lift
its best if you ask the people at the car park. north is considerably harder than south

Me and girlfriend started to hitchike here towards the north in heavy rain and in just a minute two older gentlemens from Pakistan picked us up. They didn't even know where they are and because they were so friendly and funny and they needed our help with the navigation we stayed with them the whole day! We had a great road trip around Skye and all the way to Loch Ness. :)
The best spot in the tourist season. A bunch of cars park here because the Old man of Storr and you can get rides in both directions.

At the moment there is construction work, so it's not possible to hitchhike to London, for example. The security staff will not let you stay on the port area. If you want to go to Calais, it should still possible to go and try in the travel centre.

Got lucky, almost nobody buying a ticket but found somebody very quickly anyway.

Much better to find somebody before arriving here!

I confirm that i could ask the office worker to confirm that it's the same price for the driver. Depending on when you go there, there might be veeery few people going to the travel center : people book their tickets on the web, when they  take the boat for work and it's not holidays nor week end... we found someone after 1h (we were 2 boys)

10 minutes to find a lift by directly asking to people making the queue to buy the ticket to cross by car. As it is a travel centre, you'll be unnoticed with your backpack. Your driver won't have to change the number of passengers in the car, as you ask them for a lift before they buy it. It looks like you can even ask the office worker to confirm it is the same price for the car, no matter how many people are in it.
got a ride straight to Dover in 40 mins

Yes, also got a few fast lifts from there, the spot is naturally perfect. But! There is a NO STOPPING sign and many otherwise willing drivers are probably afraid. There's still the brave ones though :)
Twice I was hitchhiking from there to the southeast, and never had to wait longer then 10 min.
Beside the road there is plenty of space, enough to stop even a lorry.
A layby on the A9 direction Glasgow. Great spot, 15 min walk from the traffic circle. Better to hitchhike here then in the petrol station.
Also very good going north to Inverness. Impossible after dark, though.
I agree. This road is kind.
Plenty of decent spots along this road out of Fort William. I didn't wait long at all. Rides in the highlands were generally short distances, but also short waits in between. Friendly folk up here.
agree with this guy, easy peasy
just sit by the coop and youl be fine
Nice spot
Heading to Glasgow, it's little bit dangerous getting there from the services but if you get there, there is a perfect spot where the car can stop.
Lots of places to pull over, and got a lift from tourists. Most traffic headed to oban so had to change rides at Ballachulish

Pass of Glencoe, A82; main route from Fort William and the West Coast to the rest of Scotland, lots of traffic, and plenty of space to stop. (parking places) Get rides in the weekends as far as Edinburgh or Glasgow from climbers. Average waiting time; <10 minutes.

Still a very good spot. Caught a ride to Manchester at 2am after about an hour's wait after I had already caught a ride here at 9pm -- unfortunately the truck driver gave me bad info on where he was going, fortunately he passed by here again three hours later to bring me back...
great spot for lifts north - got a lift to scotland within 1 minute.
Warwick services - okay spot to find a lift into Birmingham

Hitchhiking with sign "London M40", the traffic is pretty fast, but I think it's the best spot to get to London, most of the traffic goes that direction. Got 2 cars at once asking me if I wanna go.. wasn't all the way to Central London but was quite close

A40 Eastbound truck stop.
This is a fantastic place to get a lift to the South, as most M40-Southbound traffic from Oxford goes past this truck stop.

We hitched from here as there's a great lay-by! We didn't wait for longer than 10-15min. This car didn't take us to our destination but it was heading in the same direction which was good! (summer 2019)
huge laybe - perfect for going to Skye!!
A fantastic lay-by.
Got dropped off here begin of April. Got a ride at 6pm within 5min with my sign saying "M6 North". Waited after the petrol station. But you can even ask people at parking area.
great spot. waited 10 minutes, got a lift to Carlisle services.

Good spot to go northbound. Just got dropped of there and waited about 10 min.

Also possibility to cross Motorway!
The highway was under conctruction at that time so not many cars stopped there. I got the ride from the lorry driver in the end.

Took me a long time to get a lift! Three hours waiting from 1700 on a Monday... Eventually got a lift heading South by talking at the gas pumps. Still probably the best option for getting out of Glasgow.
Petrol station
Good place to catch a ride north to London. Waited 20 mins, which is about the same time as waiting for a train. Plus no hyper inflated rail fares!

Would have to agree that airport security can be cagey. There is a free travel zone operating around the airport on the tube/buses which will get you to the A4 or A30 (Hatton Cross tube station) which would be far safer areas to hitch from.

http://www.tfl.gov.uk/tfl/gettingaround/maps/buses/pdf/heathrowterminals123-13970.pdf

It 's forbiden to stay anyway at Heathrow with a sign. I tried to wait at Arrival hall on Terminal 1, by taxi drivers. When you see taxi driver going out with olny one person just ask them about lift to center. I got ride with first person I asked.

This is a bit of a special spot - it can be very rewarding if you're going north (don't bother if you're going south, service stations are a much better bet) - but it's super hard work to find the right spot to ask around (for example short term parking spots, although there are a lot of taxi drivers and people going to london), and there is so much going on... plus airport security might not really like you so much.
Great services, very busy and all southbound! Asked one person and got a lift straight to Bristol! Another time only took 10 mins for a lift to M4
Asked around. Got taken to Leicester Forest services within nothing. Great spot
very good spot for m1 traffic, got a quick lift to trowell services
Someone took us to a Service Station on the A1 from here. Were holding a sign that said South.
Asked around on ferry and found a lift and a place to stay!
The whole island will pick you up!

easy lift to Falls of falloch. some people wait here for a bus up north but i was picked up quicker than them.
ride from Johnny & Kev
Once again a worth the walk. A 10 min wait got me a ride with a really cool person to fort Augustus!! Saw two older bearded hitchikers further in fort william hitchiking a busstop. Thumb only.

The best spot in fort William for north to Inverness, way better than the crappy gas station. Walk along the nice off road cycle path on the right side of the road heading north for 10 mins and you reach a big lay-by. Good visibility, not crazy fast yet, plenty of space to pull over. Ride in 3 mins! Worked well in busy summer as well. Worth the walk.
Good spot not that known about yet but has potential. Got a lift from a holiday coach!
Recently renovated service station. Great for getting out of Sheffield. We asked around for a lift for only a few minutes before getting an empty coach to Leeds!
people are friendly and interactive here, easy to get a lift along towards the M5
A good spot, there's a layby about 1/4 of a mile past the a39 roundabout which is perfect for getting lifts.
good spot. slowly traffic. waited there around 20 min. You just should meet right driver - and than everything will be ok ;)
Take a train from Manchester, Bolton to Blackrod. You can see how to walk to here from the train station (10-15 minutes). Easy to catch a ride straight to Glasgow or Edinburgh
Map marker is in the wrong place. Also, much better to wait after the first roundabout as cars get off the ferry. Motorway is barely an option anymore. See Holyhead wiki page
Stand on the onramp beside the McDonalds just down from the roundabout. Decent pull off, cars not too fast
We had a sign "Wales" and stood at the entrance of the service station, got a ride in 5min all the way to Magor
Reading Services, M4 towards Bristol. Good place to find cars heading further west.
Got picked up twice within 5 minutes, asking around at the petrol station.

It is a petrol station in the Highway M1. Its a very good place to start if you want to go far, and you dont have time to wait for a lift from the city center. To get here you can take the buses 13A, 48, 152, 153, 158 from the center of Leicester. The ticket is around 2 or 3 pounds. If you say you want to go as close as possible to the M1 bridge, the bus driver will tell you where to jump off along Hinckley road. You take then Baines Lane until you are in the petrol station, you can use this pla

Got dropped off here begin of April. Got a ride at 5pm within 10min with my sign saying "M6 North". Waited after the petrol station. Since there is no service but just the petrol station its not that busy.
M6 North

Good lay-by/bus stop + busy traffic.
Hitched here begin of April 2017 at 1pm with sign saying "M6 North"
Got a lift within 20 min.
There's a fairly good lay-by here where cars can stop, by a big road sign of the directions out of Cardiff.
3 cars in 10 minutes. I was one 1 young guy.
Heading to Birmingham, busy place, lots of lorries.
AWESOME and SAFE spot to hitchhike to LONDON or WEST.
we took theh village way to Lisburn from thhe airport. Nice irish farmers took us!
Got a lift to Leatherhead (on the M25)
Oxford Services - used by motorway (M40) and local traffic (A418) in all directions.

I waited here at this gas station for about 5 minutes until someone stopped to pick me up. They had to pull over in the "no entry" gap of the gas station because by the time he noticed me there was nowhere else to stop. Luckily, there were no vehicles exiting the gas station at that time so there was space for him to stop there briefly. I would recommend standing further down the road from the gas station to hitchhike so that drivers have the time to see you and then make a decision to stop for
Plenty of locals will give you a lift on Islay. Didn't wait more than 10 minutes anywhere the entire stay there.
Didn't wait for a lift more than 15 minutes the entire stay on Arran. Super friendly locals.

Stood just after the junction under a distance sign; got a lift up the String Road (B880) within 5mins - second car which came by :)
Helps to have a sign here.
Didn't wait for a lift more than 15 minutes the entire stay on Arran. Super friendly locals.
Stood by a distance sign here - got a ride to Lamlash in 10mins :)
Didn't wait for a lift more than 15 minutes the entire stay on Arran. Super friendly locals.
HH in Arran seems to be very easy. We often had the first passing car stopping to pick us up. Both locals and tourists are pretty nice and traffic is not that poor in summer.

I've hitchhiked from the services at Stansted Airport twice, both times waiting about 20 minutes, but had cars apologizing that they were going the wrong direction. Having a sign is an absolute must. (The staff at the restaurants are very friendly and gave me cardboard and wished me luck) The truckers I spoke to were very kind and helped me out by taking me all the way to Leicester, but you can really get most places from here. The actual exit isn't that great of a spot so I suggest going to the
next to the ruined church. cars can stop and go back to Portree
there is no bus on Sunday, but there is quite good traffic!
to Dunvegan castle
it's easy to stop for the cars. it was just a minute!
to Ullapool
to Edinburgh
Quiet road but almost everyone there will be able to take you at least to the main road.
Got a lift going South within 20 minutes on a Monday night (2100). Just asked everyone who was filling up.
Petrol station.
Got a lift from a friendly truck driver at 2230 on a Monday night after only waiting 20 minutes. Just asked everyone who was filling up.
Petrol station with truck stop round the back
very good spot and all vehicles going to Dundee and beyond will pass through!
Parking area with plenty of space for vehicles to pull up.
On the way from Skye got a lift to Lochailort (direction Fort William) in 15 minutes.
found a lift in under a minute! (probably luck)  best place to stand, as you get traffic from the services and petrol station.. with great visibility and lots of space to stop
Heading to Bristol from here. Been waiting less than five min at 10am on a bus stop corner (A36). Pick up by a car straight to Bristol.
Quite a good spot inside the roundabout because the road is very large, got picked by a lorry in less then 10min
Direction to Winchester, always I got a lift very quickly, even in the early morning
Good point for hitching to North Berwick - had a lift within 5 mins. A big sign helped!

Awesome spot to go east! 
Waited here for about 5 minutes.

As soon as you lift your thumb, somebody stops. Used for going east, got a lift to Banchory first and another one to Aberdeen. Quite a busy road, but cars aren't so fast and have a lot of space to stop.

Good spot as it's very close to the First Aberdeen bus station (you can use your Aberdeen City bus ticket) and cars have plenty of space to stop.
Excellent for going to the west. I got a ride to Banchory, but cars go also much further (Braemar).
Great spot, after waiting for 3 minutes one lady stopped and drove me all the way to Ballater, even though she was only heading to Aboyne!
It's ok. Guy who was leaving gas station picked me up to Bromsgrove. I waited something about 20 minutes at the early evening.
Direction: M5 south (Bristol). Here you get both trafic from the gas station and the road. Plenty of space to stop. A gold spot.
After 8 minutes I stopped... the bus to Worcester. :D One Briton used his travel card after driver's approval. Really awkward situation. :D
Nice place to hitch-hike towards South.
Got picked up immediately in front of this gas station. Plenty of room for cars to stop.

stood here in 2003
in the bar in the back of the hotel their works the three titted lady
got a ride after some beers their
stood there for hours
Bettyhill. Easy to see traffic coming off the hill, both ways, plenty of place to stop. Friendly locals.
Great spot for heading up north to Inverness. Cars go fast but have enough time to see you and have a lot of space to stop. Walk from Aviemore 5 mins.
Great spot for visiting the Trotternish. There is just enough space for a car to stop.

A non-conventional hitchiking spot towards Portree. Cars can stop on the crossroads with smaller roads. There is a great beach a 100 m down hill behind the cemetery that is very popular with the locals.
Hitchiking spot towards Broadford. A lot of space for the cars to stop.
hitching south on m1. god slip road, but bit difficult to get around the roundabout. but good hard shouler for cars to stop and picked up one time in 5 mins

Good spot to go South to Glasgow !
I just waited 2 seconds ^^

Really good place if you want to go North to Scotland and Edinburgh !
I waited 10 minutes there !
got ride to M4 within 20 min

Fleet Services (Direction London and
North): This is your last spot before
the M25, it is the best spot to be
before the M25
We had to walk a long time from Pitlochry to get there, but it is the best spot to head North from Pitlochry.
Layby, people can see you from a great distance.
Great spot, got a ride north easily with a sign saying M40 where I could easily keep hitching all the way to Glasgow

The point is great for hitching towards Oxford/Birmingham (M40) or M25 - also, there is a hatched-marking section, where a car can stop to pick you up even when the traffic is heavy.
Always stand with a sign stating your destination, as a lot of traffic goes round M25.

Also, there is an OxfordTube bus stop nearby, so you can always take the bus if you are really stuck.
Great place! Cars going slow, and the road is straight for good visibility. Enjoy riding through Snowden!
Very good place to hitchhike to south. You will wait just few minutes.
Good place to go to Lizard, where it is easy to be seen. Just walk a little down the road so the cars can get on the side by the grass.
Although a long walk from Marazion and Mount St Michael, good place to hitch a ride east.
In front of the side road, good place for cars to see you and stop. 3 cars stopped, before I could get one going to Penzance.

[A38 EASTBOUND]

It took a matter of seconds holding up a "DERBY :)" sign in order to get me a hitch there on a recent sunny weekday afternoon. This spot is a safe 1.9 mile walk from Lichfield Trent Valley Station, well connected to Birmingham and the West Coast Main Line. One thing to be wary of is that the layby is not long after the brow of a hill and traffic is moving quickly so it's advisable to stand closer to the exit of the layby so as to allow traffic the time to stop.
Stand on the corner where the trucks go past, we managed to get a lift down to the services before the M^/M5 branch.
Good spot for going to Liverpool or Manchester (except when there's a football crowd), but you'll be hard pressed finding anything going further south.
I was trying to get a lift in the evening after the Green Welly Stop had closed and it was kinda tricky, but I got one from a layby before the GWS after about 15mins, going north to Glencoe village.
The Green Welly Stop is an amazing place to find rides in every direction - it works a bit like a service station.
The best place in Pontypridd to go South.  The roundabout is tight but wide.  Stand on it so people see you.  Do not stand on the slip road, you will be moved and traffic is travelling too fast.
Well worth the walk to the first pull in, normally get a lift within 10 minutes (used about 30 times).
If you don't want to stand on a sliproad this is probably the best place to get a lift from anywhere near here, heading south.

Just after the garage, just before the bus stop...
Good place to get a lift to Glasgow or Stirling (and beyond) - you can hitch to traffic on the main road and traffic coming out of the petrol station too, and there's space for cars to stop in the bus stop/lane
Good place to get towards the west from here, there's a small spot for cars to pull over
Heading south from tain, it's better to walk this far. Long, spaceous layby and cars have plenty of time to see you!
Best place to hitch out of here, A483 towards Builth Wells. Hard shoulder and good visability.
After you exit the Stena terminal, head straight to here. Somebody will probably take you to Stranraer soon enough. Never waited more than 15 minutes here
Very scenic route and you're better off taking that way instead of the motorway - people going are very likely to stop.

A safe bet for getting to Edinburgh.  
Not the heaviest traffic, but many are headed to Edinburgh. 
Good layby for stopping.  Walking up the road a little you'll find other decent stopping points.  Also near services if the weather gets too much
Good spot for heading the Sligo direction.
This is the best place I have tried this far. There is a long lay-by-lane going west, and if you stand the right place you will be seen from all lanes.
A bus stop near the Caledonian Canal walk.
A great place, cars can see you clearly and they can pull over to the bus stop.
This might be the best place to hitchhike from Rye.

Hitched to London in front of the Park n Ride. Had a sign with "M40" on it, but should've written "London" Got 2-3 offers for short trips, but held out for a ride to London.  Total wait: 30 min. Great thing is if you don't get your ride to London, can always catch the bus at Park n Ride.

Hitchers are very visible and its easy for cars to stop. If you're going to Cheltenham or Gloucester, its best not to take a lift to where the route splits- its a fast, dangerous junction. Its better to wait till you can get a lift to your destination. That said, if you're destination is Cheltenham and you're offered a lift to Painswick it's possibly worth taking it.
Good place to hitch north or south.
Great place with a full width hard shoulder for cars to stop easily.
Swanage is a very easy hitch.
Small layby opposite Cirencester College. Its a bit of a walk from the town centre, but excellent spot for a lift to Stroud or beyond.
An easy enough hitch out east. Many folk may not be going very far though.

Heading East along the A14 towards cambridge- there is  space for a vehicle to stop and its straight after the roundabout so the traffic isn't too fast. 
BUT traffic can be VERY heavy on this road, so it may be difficult to get a lift at rush hour.
southbound to Kintyre, stand just south of the bridge over the Crinan Canal.
I've tried it. Works well. Just find a spot where cars can pull in.

Anywhere along this road seems good for Laxey, but I haven't tested it.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Douglas
There's a great hitching spot for going into Oxford from here.
This place is actually Campbeltown
There's a lay-byish place somewhere around here. People will mercilessly use it!
It is easy to get rides locally on Berneray if you are staying at the Youth Hostel, especially during Berneray Week. To get rides off Berneray, hitch from the causeway.
A nice long lay-by on the A34 Southbound - traffic can see you from a long distance and stop safely. 1/2-mile walk from the slip road.
Direction South (Penzance): Safe spot, good visibility and possibility for cars to stop safely, you can stand in the grass verge

Direction South: Just at the entrance of the Shell Gas Station, you can stand there and catch the traffic coming from the station on the right. If the hitching is unsuccessful you can always catch the train or the bus from the very same spot

The spot to leave Penzance to Land's End: There is a shoulder that seems just perfectly built for a car to stop and pick a hitcher; the cars are going slowly enough because of the roundabout and it your destination is usually quite obvious when you reached that spot
To Wimborne or further, nice place for a car to pull after the roundabouts
Direction Cromer following the coast, slow traffic, obvious destination and place for a car to pull aside.

The best hitching spot I know.. Hitch normally to King's Lynn, though I've been taken as far as Thetford (and 2 people giving me long rides, one to East London and one to Essex, told me they'd just been from Heacham (4 miles north of Dersingham), though they picked me up in places further along).  Make sure if you're going further than King's Lynn to have a sign for the Hardwick roundabout, as it isn't reachable by public transport.

Towards Perth. Take a bus from the centre of Edinburgh towards Queens Ferry road, get out at the juction with Maybury road and walk along the raod while you find a decent spot to hitch. If you have time before hitchhiking, I suggest a walk along  the River Almond.
direction Aberdeen or Invernes if you are lucky
Slip road onto M6- also a good place to get rides south. Even though it's north of Carlisle, there's still a lot of traffic. And a wide shoulder for people to pull off.
All the trafic goes to M5 (towards Birmingham), there's a service way so they can stop for you. I hitched here in dark at 2009 December and I was picked up in 30 mins to B'ham.

Lay-by bus stop before traffic lights with covered shelter. Nearly all traffic heading out of Cambridge city center heading south passes here. Local shops and petrol station just to the north, supermarket just to the south.
Truck stop with plenty of trucks, cafeteria and sleeping possibilities. Got a ride to Birmingham after 1 hour.
This parking, mainly used by climbers, is a fabulous spot for both directions - it's usually well-frequented, even in September.
Going north.

I got away quickly towards the north-west even though I didn't even go to the main road because of the rain... and you'll get closer to a magical place called Scoraig if you hitch down the tiny road towards the north-east!
If this is a petrol station (I'm not a 100 % sure), it's a great spot to get going south, and in a pinch north, too.
Probably your best bet to get back north from Campbelltown. Please report any suspicious police activity in the area back to me, please :-)
As soon as you get off the main road headed towards the Mull of Kintyre, everyone will offer to take you. If you go later than August though, that's not gonna help you very much.
Even though you're now in the English part of Scotland if it comes to hitchhiking, this spot will help you to be gone quite soon.
There's a hidden lay-by somewhere around here; people will happily oblige :-)
A lot of people will be headed towards Letterkenny from here. Ample hard shoulder.
Maybe it was luck, but I got an almost instant ride to Derby from a guy that stopped to pick me up at the bus stop.
Got a ride direct to Bangor, after about one minute.

If coming from the Isle of Man, arrange a ride on the ferry! Many cars going in many directions.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Heysham

Get a ride from the other passengers on your plane! This works very well for all destinations, but there are very few cars. If you don't succeed, you can walk towards Ballasalla (if going north) or Castletown (if going south) and try on the main road.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Castletown
Excellent spot for getting a ride to anywhere on the island... if there are cars!

Choose your spot, make sure you're visible, and you will get a ride to Ramsey very quickly.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/St._John's_(Isle_of_Man)

Excellent spot next to Braddan Bridge, in front of Kirk Braddan. Get rides west towards Peel, or around the TT course.
http://hitchwiki.org/en/Douglas

Both the gas station and the bus stop just out of it seems to be very good. At the end I got a lift (to Aberdeen) thumbing at th bus stop, but when I went in the gas station to ask some driver some asked me where I was going before I could ask them.. other cars had stopped before I got the lift, but they were going just halfway and adviced me to keep try there as further north there are no good spots (no space to stop) so try to avoid half-way lifts.
Great spot for going south, north and even to Edinburgh (at least if there's rugby). Plus, there's cool freaky geese licking liquid from the ground in the petrol station^^
Got a lift to London in no time at all.
Many tourists. Which can also, sometimes, mean many people who are in the mood to spice up their holiday by picking up a hitchhiker for the first time.
Either this is an excellent spot, it I just had excellent luck. But I waited five minutes, and the second car already stopped, and I got a ride all the way to Leeds. I had a sign saying "A1 - North".

Petrol station and Greggs. Great for asking around for a lift but its also on a busy road so I waited at the station exit to try and catch both. Theres a road and car park just above the station for someone to pull into
Banging spot for a ride north from the train station. Much shorter walk than the hermitage spot.
Litterally the first car. Good traffic, good area to pull off. If your lift is going the wrong way at the juction north of here, this is a great spot to pick a ride headed north!
First guys I asked gave me a ride to Bristol airport!
Just walk a little further to here and you get a very large bus lay-by!
2mins on a Sunday. The roundabout to the north would be even better but had my sign out just for luck and got picked up in no time. Theres a big shopping mall in Bangor so many cars going that way.

Picked up by two lovely Italian tourists. There are long sections of parking on both sides of the road at this point, so it's easy for drivers to pull in. Due to the exposure and lack of public transport, a lot of people will take pity on you and offer to drive you west (to Glossop) or east (to Sheffield).
hitched back to the motorway after going to the dales for a bit of hiking, was really easy, got there over a couple rides and only waited a few minutes in between rides
Hitched north onto the M1 twice from this spot, never had to wait more than 20 minutes. Plenty of room to pull in at the bus stop and ample time for vehicles to see you as they round the corner.

Very good spot here ! Nice and warm coffee where you can get the best hot chocolate you've never drink...
+ parking of the coffee where you can easily ask the customers for a lift.
Second car I asked took me to the outskirts of London.
Excellent spot to join Newcastle ! A lot of trafic and a good place to park for the drivers, although a lot of of them were going to the south.
Excellent spot ! Petrol stations are always the good place to hitchhike ! 1h of ride until Wetherby.
Excellent spot ! Petrol stations are always the good place to hitchhike ;)
Good if you want to get to the M3, and very close frome the train station.
It is in the middle of the town but the cars are going slowly and there is a bus stop for them to pull over. Good place to go to Glencoe or Oban.
Good spot to get out of Isle of Skye from Portree. Cars can pull over either in a driveway or on the petrol station. You can also try asking the people stopped at the petrol station.
A lot of traffic, most cars driving north from Stirling will use this road. The cars are driving slowly because they are exiting the roundabout and there is a lot of space to pull over.
Good lift slow traffic due to sight li es. No notes really
Cars can pull into the housing estate and see you from the main road, little problem to wait their good amount of pavement

Great spot, maybe got lucky but a delivery driver took me trait to edinburgh. The only problem is getting here if you haven't just got drop of because the closest train station is 5km but still not bad.
Great spot just hard to walk to from Kingussie
Good if you want to head north. People come to eat and stop for gas
Great spot if you want to head north to the M5, we got a ride in 2 minutes

beautiful spot to look around and hitch from. great layby.
lift from George
We wanted to head to exeter. Really busy in summer. Very easy to find rides, most of them heading to cornwall
We were ambitious trying to get to Wells. Got a ride after 30 min. Lots of people heading to bristol, even london
Best to ask parked cars at the service station. Lots of cars heading south in summer but if you are lucky there are some heading north.
If you need to get out of exmouth, great road heading only one way to exeter. We were dropped at exeter services

Best spot out of this town I think. Two women picked up us two men saying, I gotta help out fellow hitch hikers!

Direction Salisbury, good place in the shade under trees yet good visibility, also enough place to stop. Not too many cars, but got a hitch reasonably fast.
Waited literally 5 seconds, great spot, lots of space to stop, got a hitch all the way to Bristol from here
Not an amazing spot but just doable on the small road, got picked up in less than 10 minutes towards sennen cove and land's end.

Just wandering the road with thumb, got a quick ride to the junction with a kind local.
Glorious place to hitchhike after getting off the ferry, 3 cars stopped at once, people were nearly fighting over me!
decent place to get to the ferry in Gills bay, cars can stop farely easily

Not much traffic but found it very easy to get rides to and from Suardalan Bothy along the old military road (that what its called on google maps)

The original Spaghetti junction - never tried it myself, but I can image it'd be average to bad, although in walking distance from Birmingham city center and also safely reachable on foot. Quite good spot under the bridge. There are traffic lights so cars are slow and can see you. They can pull off aside though it needs a bit of motivation for driver.
Try and meet someone on the ferry as its unlikely you'll make it off the ferry before the cars start to leave. If you do make it off before them then position yourself at the pub.
Most cars going North are heading for the ferry. Try and get to the ferry ports and hitch from there when a ferry comes in.
Trying to get a ride into town it's easiest to walk along the road in that direction. In the evening it is near-impossible to find a ride as there is almost no traffic.
hhiking from summer solstice to london, however we started at 7pm, so on the end we didnt get anybody, and had o negotiate taxi to salisbury and take train..

I arrived at the spot, on a monday at 10:30. Given this gas station being fairly big and having a high traffic frequency I was astonished that I only after more than two-and-a-half hours, the first vehicle stopped to pick me up. I am not sure, if this was due to the rain, or the spot being located in Britain. Tough Time!
It seemed to be a good spot towards Dover (A2 entrance, lights) but I had to wait there for two hours.

The thing is that you mustn't hitch in the tunnel train and when people book their tickets they need to claim how many people there are in the car so they don't stop. I got to the train area but was drove back to Dover by a policeman. It esaier to take the ferry.

Looks like a good place to hitch the Channel, but I was caught by the Eurotunnel security after 20 minutes of waiting (about 10 cars passed). They were quite friendly, but told me the Eurotunnel compagny has an anti-hitchhiker policy, and also that they are patrolling by car all the time, and I would be sent away even if I found a car from somewhere else. I didn't try to prove they were wrong and found a car in the ferry three hours later.

Eventhough, there is a McDonald's here, and a gas station, it took me two hours, on a late wednesday morning to get a ride north on the A10. Cars a are driving by fast, and there is loads of them. Technically conditions should be really good, but I had a tough time here.
Services off the road. To be avoided.
Me anf a friend spent about 4 hours in total near a petrol station (by the  exit of the services) and then got a lift to folkestone. (April 2015)

Me and a friend thumbed on the bend here for a couple of hours. Had to endure 3 drivers / passengers yelling / signalling abuse at us (no idea why). We moved on down the A20 to a petrol station where a guy gave us a lift. A local couple were friendly here, giving us advice. (April 2015)

Thurrock services: Me and a friend spent around 4 hours over two days before we got a lift. Although, we did have people pulling up but unforunately they were going in a different direction to where we wanted to go (south eastwards) (April 2015).

If you're hitching the A40, avoid having to stand in Monmouth if you possibly can. The road layout makes no sense - a dual carriageway with almost nowhere for cars to stop. If you have to go from Monmouth though, this is the only place I've had any luck. The southbound route is a little easier as the small exit for Old Dixton Road is pretty quiet and acts as a pull-in for cars. Northbound looks hard - not done this direction myself as I now avoid Monmouth like the plague.
Waited there like forever... better go to the busstop down the road!! Only good thing is it's very close to the beach and a nice kiosk is round the corner.
Good Luck for going to Kyle of Lochalsh
pretty bad spot to hitchhike, no place for cars to stop, un endroit de merde que je deconseille, pas de place pour que les voitures s;arretent

Not good spot, however I was lucky. Going to Ledbury.
Bus station heading north.
Quite bad spot, because cars are going really fast (90 kmph). However, people are really friendly here and sooner or later someone will stop.

my parents live at the top of the hill so I have tried this route a few times and the only times I got picked up were by a family friend, my father picks up hitchhikers sometimes though so you never know...
avoid Exeter Services
Direction South: No shoulder and dense traffic at this roundabout, the only solution is to try with the cars that are stopped at the red light (Exeter Services is not a good option)
very  very  quiet in evening ..... but  there are  fewother  options
Not much southbound traffic coming from Asda but I got a lift after ~40min in the dark.
From local knowledge I can confirm that this is quite a fast moving roundabout.
The traffic lights on the roundabout may be the only chance to get a lift on M25 from Staines or around. Cars have no space to pull over so you need to be quick.
Really depends on the people on the day as to how quickly you get a lift.  The area in general is difficult.
The best place in Pontypridd to go South.  The roundabout is tight but wide.  Stand on it so people see you.  Do not stand on the slip road, you will be moved and traffic is travelling too fast.

Going southbound.
Traffic is slow but single lane only.  No place for cars to stop.
Better for local routes e.g. Preston
Wide road and very fast traffic.  There are no places for cars to stop.  Only seasoned people will give lifts.  Not recommended during rush hours.

Got stuck here for hours at 5pm in the winter (in the dark) heading south. Seemed to be a lot of local traffic, but too close to london for many long-distance travellers to be stopping. Might be better in the light, but ultimately fairly quiet and unpromising.

Not a very easy place to get a lift at all. Two of us waited 2 hours, gave up and tried the side road... eventually opted for a taxi to Wetherby Services, which is the only time i've ever got a taxi while hitching!
If you're looking for a good spot to hitch out of Balmaha... well, there isn't really one. Stay here or keep walking... all the way to Drymen. there aren't any laybys.
Only hitch here if it's dark! Otherwise head up the hill to the layby. If you're here in the dark, it may take a while but as long as it's not past 9 you should get a lift eventually

best bet for hitching west from brighton. Don't bother with the layby further along the A27, you might get a lift but generally traffic's too fast. Just off the roundabout there's room for another car to pass one that stops for you.
heading east or towards london. tricky spot, fast cars coming off the junction, but there isn't anywhere else for quite a way. (you're better bussing it a way out of portsmouth...)

If you're unlucky enough to be dropped here it's your only chance of heading north unless you want to walk 3 miles along the motorway, which is nor particularly fun! better to ask the driver to take you as far as the Broxden roundabout - it's only 5 minutes out of their way, and an hour walk for you. But i was stuck here once and got a lift within the hour so it's not the end of the world.
Don't be dropped here on your way to Builth Wells along the A470. Traffic is going too fast to stop, altough some might :)
Can be good spot for M8 East. Many cars can spot you, but there's almost nowhere to stop.
Would be good during week time for M8 East (that is Stirling and Edinburgh). Better locations are at the end of Sauchiehall, where St. George's Road joins M8, and the end of Garscube road.
Was lucky but not much space to pull over
Direction Honiton (Exeter Airport): Not the best spot as there is no shoulder but the road is large enough for a car willing to stop

Not good. You'll wait for a long time, get a lot of abuse and the like. I ended up walking to the next junction, several miles to the East.

somewhere here on the motorway is a shell petrol station. it seems useful, but the guard (june 2011) there was a very annoying person who threatened us and kicked us off - despite heavy rain "you can't hitchhike on shell property!" was his remark. if you can avoid it, do so.

Do NOT get stuck here; ferry traffic is low enough, and you don't want to wait an hour extra. Anywhere sees more action than this spot.

No chance from here. Difficult and waited ages for it.

Took us 5 hours to get anywhere, not too much traffic.
service station, slow traffic - not a bad place for getting onto the M62

Not a lot of space to pull over, and people will not really feel addressed even if you have an Edinburgh sign and they go there.

Not a good place for going south - even though there isn't a lot of traffic, it's a main road and people are afraid to stop on the road itself, which they'd have to do as there is no opportunity to pull over.

Using a sign going south it is bad. Waited an hour, and 90 mins respectively here, too many cars travelling in several different directions

Not a perfect place at all, but the first acceptable one after Pwheli. Cars come quite fast around a bend that's sharper than on the map. Still this spot turned out to be a gift of the heavens for me.

Not a good spot for drivers to stop (even though its possible), at least if you want to get to Glasgow.

Stuck at this garage for four hours in the freezing cold. If you're going south on the M42, try to do it all in one go if you can, I can't explain why but I always find it real sticky. The caretaker/attendant guy at this garage was friendly, at least.

Bus stop just before the roundabout, direction Cardiff. After the roundabout the traffic can go there either with the highway or with a national road A48. to take M62 dont wait on this spot, cars go fast
